含义: The character '水' means 'water'. It represents one of the essential elements of life, symbolizing purity, fluidity, and adaptability.
字形: The character '水' is a pictograph that resembles flowing water. It consists of three strokes: a central vertical stroke representing the main flow, and two shorter strokes on either side representing smaller streams or ripples.
读音: The pronunciation of '水' is 'shuǐ' in Mandarin Chinese.
字源: The character '水' originated from ancient pictographs that depicted flowing water. Over time, it evolved into its current simplified form, maintaining its representation of water.
成语: 水到渠成 (shuǐ dào qú chéng) - When water flows, a channel is formed; things will naturally work out when conditions are ripe.
水落石出 (shuǐ luò shí chū) - When the water recedes, the rocks appear; the truth comes to light.
水滴石穿 (shuǐ dī shí chuān) - Constant dripping wears away the stone; perseverance prevails.
水乳交融 (shuǐ rǔ jiāo róng) - As well blended as milk and water; in perfect harmony.
例句: 水是生命之源。 (Shuǐ shì shēngmìng zhī yuán.) - Water is the source of life.
他每天喝八杯水。 (Tā měitiān hē bā bēi shuǐ.) - He drinks eight glasses of water every day.
水能载舟，亦能覆舟。 (Shuǐ néng zài zhōu, yì néng fù zhōu.) - Water can carry a boat, but it can also overturn it.
短故事: Once upon a time, there was a wise old man who lived by a river. He often told his grandchildren, 'Water is the most powerful force in the world. It can carve mountains and shape the land. But it is also gentle and nurturing, giving life to all living things.'

In ancient China, there was a legend about a dragon king who controlled all the waters of the world. He could bring rain to the fields or cause floods with a flick of his tail. People would pray to him for good harvests and protection from disasters.
诗词:
《静夜思》 - 李白 (Jìng Yè Sī - Lǐ Bái)
床前明月光，疑是地上霜。
举头望明月，低头思故乡。
(The moonlight shines brightly before my bed, I wonder if it's frost on the ground. I raise my head to gaze at the moon, then lower it, thinking of my hometown.)

《登鹳雀楼》 - 王之涣 (Dēng Guàn Què Lóu - Wáng Zhī Huàn)
白日依山尽，黄河入海流。
欲穷千里目，更上一层楼。
(The sun sets behind the mountains, the Yellow River flows into the sea. To see a thousand miles further, climb one more floor of the tower.)
